overview.summary: A personal portfolio that stays automatically up to date by pulling live data from GitHub repositories.
overview.problem: Keeping a portfolio current is often manual, repetitive, and easy to neglect as projects evolve.
overview.solution: A config-driven portfolio that treats GitHub as a single source of truth, automatically updating project content without manual edits.

responsibilities: Designed and built the full application architecture
Integrated GitHub API for dynamic project data
Implemented reusable configuration for easy adaptation to other users

architecture.approach: Single Page Application with modular, reusable components
architecture.data_flow: Live data fetched from the GitHub API and structured through project-specific JSON files
architecture.deployment: Automated deployment to GitHub Pages using CI/CD workflows

key_features: Automatically syncs projects and repository details from GitHub
Reusable configuration to adapt the portfolio to any GitHub user
Responsive layout inspired by developer-focused platforms
challenges_and_learnings: Designing a structure flexible enough to support multiple project types
Balancing automation with clarity for non-technical visitors
Building a maintainable system with minimal manual updates
